comments.snippet:
I have the same problem. In the server logs I can see that there is a mismatch with the cryptographic settings.
System in question is Ubuntu 22.04 with *openssh-server 1:8.9p1-3*.
mRemoteNG is version 1.77.1.27713 portable.

Logging on with SSH shows this in /var/log/auth.log:
```
sshd[1398]: Accepted password for xxxxxxx from a.b.c.d port 17389 ssh2
sshd[1398]: pam_unix(sshd:session): session opened for user xxxxxxx(uid=1000) by (uid=0)
```
Trying to transfer files shows this in /var/l...
comments.author: matwei

comments.snippet:
This might correlate with the used putty version, see #2220 

Could you try to replace the putty file in the mRemoteNG program folder with a newer version? Eg. With the one bundled with mRemoteNG version 1.77.2
comments.author: simonai1254

comments.snippet:
The old puttyng.exe identified itself as version 0.71 (2019).
I tried with another one that identified itself as version 0.77 (2022), but to no avail.

Then I had a look at the sources and saw in file *mRemoteNG/Tools/SecureTransfer.cs* the following:

```
using Renci.SshNet;
using Renci.SshNet.Sftp;
```

I do not know much about .NET programming, but this looks for me like the file transfer doesn't use putty at all.
Is it possible that mRemoteNG uses [this library](https://github.com...
comments.author: matwei

comments.snippet: hello, dev back from holidays :) need to update puttyng to latest release then will reshare so I believe that will sort that issue.
comments.author: Kvarkas

comments.snippet:
Are you sure that the problem is with puttyng?

We have no problems using the console, only for file transfer using SCP / SFTP.

When SCP / SFTP use the same binary, why would it offer different crypto settings for file transfer  versus console?
comments.author: matwei

comments.snippet: not sure tbh, but we don't work on this part of code for a long time so if its stop working its may mean they change something in protocol perhaps, will see soon.
comments.author: Kvarkas

comments.snippet:
Hi,

I had some time to look into the issue and saw in [mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG.csproj](https://github.com/mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG/blob/v1.77.3-dev/mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG.csproj) the following:

`...
<PackageReference Include="Renci.SshNet.Async" Version="1.4.0" />
...
`

Going over to https://www.nuget.org/packages/Renci.SshNet.Async/1.4.0 I saw:

> Extends Renci.SshNet to implement the task-based async pattern
> 
> Dependencies:
> 
> SSH.NET (>= 2016.1.0)

[SSH.NET](https://github.com/ss...
comments.author: matwei

comments.snippet:
Hello, 

I have checked the stable and the nightly. 

The Nightly version currently uses 2016.1.0
The stable version currently uses 2016.0.0

Both are loaded via version 1.4.0 of SshNet.Async.

NuGet does not suggest an update, but installing SSH.NET via NuGet in the current version fixes the problem.

I will probably post a pull request with fix later today.
comments.author: pakass

comments.snippet: I tested an experimental portable version of mRemoteNG from @pakass and was able to  transfer files with a SSH server on Ubuntu 22.04 using the experimental version while the standard version could not connect to this server without modification of the server configuration.
comments.author: matwei

comments.snippet: Triage refresh (P2): this issue has been inactive for a long time. Please retest on the latest build and share reproducible steps, expected vs actual behavior, and logs/screenshots. If there is no confirmation/update, maintainers can close it as stale or not reproducible.
comments.author: robertpopa22
